publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7650 Jackie Baillie: Aggreko to Power London 2012—That the Parliament congratulates Aggreko on winning a £37 million contract to supply power to the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympics Games; notes that the Dumbarton-based company will provide about 220 megawatts of power for both events; understands that Aggreko has also signed up as a sponsor after winning the contract; further understands that this latest success for the company comes on the back of news that the first half yearly revenue has increased by £29 million as a result of the firm powering the 2010 World Cup, and commends all the hard work and dedication of the Aggreko staff in making the company a world leader in temporary power solutions. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S3M-7650 Jackie Baillie: Aggreko to Power London 2012—That the Parliament congratulates Aggreko on winning a £37 million contract to supply power to the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympics Games; notes that the Dumbarton-based company will provide about 220 megawatts of power for both events; understands that Aggreko has also signed up as a sponsor after winning the contract; further understands that this latest success for the company comes on the back of news that the first half yearly revenue has increased by £29 million as a result of the firm powering the 2010 World Cup, and commends all the hard work and dedication of the Aggreko staff in making the company a world leader in temporary power solutions. Supported by: Des McNulty*, Stewart Maxwell*, Jamie McGrigor*, Robin Harper*, James Kelly*, Ms Wendy Alexander*
S3M-7650 Aggreko to Power London 2012 (lodged on 22 December 2010) Pauline McNeill*, Andy Kerr*, Dr Richard Simpson*, David Whitton*, Hugh Henry*
S3M-7650 Aggreko to Power London 2012 (lodged on 22 December 2010) Stuart McMillan*

S3M-7650 Jackie Baillie: Aggreko to Power London 2012—That the Parliament congratulates Aggreko on winning a £37 million contract to supply power to the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympics Games; notes that the Dumbarton-based company will provide about 220 megawatts of power for both events; understands that Aggreko has also signed up as a sponsor after winning the contract; further understands that this latest success for the company comes on the back of news that the first half yearly revenue has increased by £29 million as a result of the firm powering the 2010 World Cup, and commends all the hard work and dedication of the Aggreko staff in making the company a world leader in temporary power solutions. Supported by: Des McNulty, Stewart Maxwell, Jamie McGrigor, Robin Harper, James Kelly, Ms Wendy Alexander, Pauline McNeill, Andy Kerr, Dr Richard Simpson, David Whitton, Hugh Henry, Stuart McMillan
